intro: Cerastium kitaibelii, commonly known as the alpine mouse-ear, is a low-growing perennial plant native to mountainous regions of Europe and Asia. It belongs to the family Caryophyllaceae and is characterized by its dense clusters of small, white flowers that bloom in early summer. The plant features hairy, spoon-shaped leaves and thrives in well-drained, rocky or sandy soils. It is often found in alpine meadows and is adapted to cold, high-altitude environments. Cerastium kitaibelii is valued for its ornamental appeal and ecological role in supporting pollinators.
